questions.question_text: Your company is using macOS devices for all employees and has built a process to allow a Google account to be used as credentials for the device. Your company wants to manage newly acquired Windows 10 devices with Google Workspace endpoint management and have employees use their Google Workspace account as login credentials for Windows 10. Which steps should you take to enable this? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Install and configure Google Credential Provider for Windows (GCPW) on each device.
choices.E: Enable Windows device management in Devices > Mobile & endpoints > Settings > Windows setting.
choices.B: Sync the Google Accounts and password to AD via Google Cloud Directory Sync V1 (GCDS).
choices.D: Configure Chrome policies on Windows to push advanced device management policies.
choices.C: Install and configure Password Sync on each Active Directory (AD) domain controller.
Check if your Google Workspace domain registration expired.
choices.D: Open a support ticket with Google Workspace Support.
choices.B: Search for missing email messages by using email Log Search (ELS), and determine why messages weren't delivered.
choices.A: Update your MX records to make sure they point to Google mail servers.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Email Log Search (ELS

Selected Answer: B
B. Email Log Search (ELS)
B log search

Selected Answer: B
https://support.google.com/a/answer/55299?hl=en

Selected Answer: B
Check the email log to determine if messages have reached Google Workspace.

questions.question_text: Several users in your organization reported an issue with receiving emails from one particular external sender. You want to troubleshoot the issue and determine whether Google received these emails. What should you do?

Your organization has confidential internal content for which only authorized employees are allowed to access. Access to this content is managed by using Google Groups. Only administrators can create and manage membership. You need to provide only the necessary functionality and follow the principle of least privilege. What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
It's B.
option D is not valid, it is not the appropriate tool to protect confidential content.

Selected Answer: B
The option B makes more sense than the others options.

B
Is the correct answer
B makes the most sense
B parece ser uma saida indicada, uma vez que fala em conteudo confidencial e privilégio minimo. Definir um grupo e aplicar politicas seria uma opção valida.

choices.C: Make a dynamic group so security team members are automatically added.
choices.A: Make a moderated group so all incoming communications can be monitored.
choices.D: Use a group as a collaborative inbox that allows easier sharing.
choices.B: Make a security group to apply access policies.

questions.question_text: An employee at your organization is having trouble playing a video stored in Google Drive that is embedded in their Google Slides presentation. You need to collect the necessary details to troubleshoot the issue. What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Agree with D

Selected Answer: D
To troubleshoot the issue with the video embedded in a Google Slides presentation, you should confirm that the source video is in a supported format and resolution, and that the user has permission to play the video. Have a screen share session with the employee to confirm the behavior. This will help identify if the issue is with the video format, permissions, or another technical problem.

choices.B: Instruct the employee to give you edit access to the presentation to review the revision history. See if the error message changes when you delete and add the slides back.
choices.C: Create a copy of the presentation to see if you can replicate the problem, and document any errors you see.
choices.A: Check the Google Drive audit logs for any error entries on the Slides presentation. Check the help center for the appropriate error message.
choices.D: Confirm that the source video is in a supported format and resolution and that the user has permission to play the video. Have a screen share session to confirm the behavior.

questions.question_text: An employee at your organization is resigning. They are in charge of organizing and maintaining recurring team events. You want to preserve the existing meetings and transfer ownership to the resigning employee's manager. What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A

When an admin deletes a user, the system doesn’t necessarily purge invitees’ copies of events that the former user created. Those copies stay in the calendars of guests and of booked resources. Also, suspended users’ events remain in Calendar, and only super administrators can modify them, not guests. 
https://support.google.com/a/answer/7400733?hl=en
Must be A

Selected Answer: A
Answer A

https://support.google.com/a/answer/7400733?hl=en

choices.B: Delete the existing calendar events and instruct the manager to create new events as the owner.
choices.D: Instruct the resigning employee to share free/busy details for their calendar with their manager.
choices.C: Assign an Archived User (AU) license for the resigning employee.
choices.A: Transfer both the events and the resources owned by the resigning employee to their manager by using the Admin console.
